figures.figures

Class Rook

  • java.lang.Object
    • figures.Figure
      • figures.figures.Rook

  • public class Rook
extends Figure
    This is a rook. Handles ever move of its self. Also implements kill() method.
    Author:
    Timon Borter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Rook(java.awt.Color givenColor)
      On creation sets color, range and turn counter.

      • move

        public java.lang.Boolean move(int givenCurrentX,
                              int givenCurrentY,
                              int givenToX,
                              int givenToY,
                              PlayerDatas givenPlayerDatas,
                              Figure[][] givenFigures)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Actualizes data with current game informations, then checks if the step is valid.
        Specified by:
        move in class Figure
        Parameters:
        givenCurrentX - The current x-coordinate (which the player selected)
        givenCurrentY - The current y-coordinate (which the player selected)
        givenToX - The selected aim x-coordinate
        givenToY - The selected aim y-coordinate
        givenPlayerDatas - Required the PlayerDatas to check color
        givenFigures - Require actual figures positions
        Returns:
        Returns true if the move is valid
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws null pointer exception for DataBase | Figure[][] == null
